hints_html:
The first derivative was needed in part (b) and has already been computed. Take the derivative of that function:

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) &= \frac{6}{5}x^{-4/5} + \frac{6}{5}x^{1/5} \\ &= \frac{6(x+1)}{5x^{4/5}}\end{aligned}\]
question: 5 (c)
sols_html:
From the initial form of the derivative, as computed in part (a),

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) = \frac{6}{5}x^{-4/5} + \frac{6}{5}x^{1/5}\end{aligned}\]

we find that the second derivative is

\[\begin{aligned} f''(x) &= \left(\frac65\right)\left(-\frac45\right)x^{-9/5} + \left(\frac65\right)\left(\frac15\right)x^{-4/5} \\ &= \frac6{25}\left(-4x^{-9/5}+x^{-4/5}\right) \\ &= \frac6{25x^{9/5}}(-4+x)\end{aligned}\]

Using the compact form of the derivative, as computed in part (b),

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) &= \frac{6(x+1)}{5x^{4/5}}\end{aligned}\]

we find the second derivative by taking the quotient rule:

\[\begin{aligned} f''(x) &= \frac{6}{5} \left( \frac{x^{4/5}-\frac{4}{5}x^{-1/5}(x+1)}{x^{8/5}} \right)\\ &= \frac{6x^{-1/5}(x - \frac{4}{5}x - \frac{4}{5})}{5x^{8/5}}\\ &= \frac{6(\frac{1}{5}x - \frac{4}{5})}{5x^{9/5}}\\ &= \frac{6(x-4)}{25x^{9/5}}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
From the initial form of the derivative, as computed in [[Science:Math Exam Resources/Courses/MATH100/December 2011/Question 5 (a)|part (a)]],

:<math>
f'(x) = \frac{6}{5}x^{-4/5} + \frac{6}{5}x^{1/5}
</math>

we find that the second derivative is

:<math>\begin{align}
f''(x) &= \left(\frac65\right)\left(-\frac45\right)x^{-9/5} + \left(\frac65\right)\left(\frac15\right)x^{-4/5} \\
&= \frac6{25}\left(-4x^{-9/5}+x^{-4/5}\right) \\
&= \frac6{25x^{9/5}}(-4+x)
\end{align}</math>
Using the compact form of the derivative, as computed in [[Science:Math Exam Resources/Courses/MATH100/December 2011/Question 5 (b)|part (b)]],

:<math>\begin{align}
f'(x) &= \frac{6(x+1)}{5x^{4/5}}
\end{align}</math>

we find the second derivative by taking the quotient rule:

:<math>\begin{align}
f''(x) &= \frac{6}{5} \left( \frac{x^{4/5}-\frac{4}{5}x^{-1/5}(x+1)}{x^{8/5}} \right)\\
&= \frac{6x^{-1/5}(x - \frac{4}{5}x - \frac{4}{5})}{5x^{8/5}}\\
&= \frac{6(\frac{1}{5}x - \frac{4}{5})}{5x^{9/5}}\\
&= \frac{6(x-4)}{25x^{9/5}}
\end{align}</math>
statement_html:
Full-Solution Problems. In questions 2-8, justify your answers and show all your work. Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly stated.

Let

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle y=f(x)=6x^{1/5}+x^{6/5}\end{aligned}\]


Find the second derivative of y=f(x).
statement_raw:
'''''Full-Solution Problems.''' In questions 2-8, justify your answers and '''show all your work.''' Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly stated.''

Let
:<math>\displaystyle
y=f(x)=6x^{1/5}+x^{6/5}
</math>
<br />
Find the second derivative of ''y=f(x)''.
